dict.string: Upload complete. Will proceed to check status.
File(s) received. Will proceed to upload.

#!/bin/bash
username="${username}" password="${password}" download_folder="$HOME/Downloads"
# Get the array and current index uuids_string="${uuids}" current_index="${current_index}"
# Split the string into array using read read -r -a uuids_array <<< "${uuids_string}"
# Get current UUID being processed uuid="${uuids_array[$current_index]}"
# Get file info and download status_response=$(curl -s https://auphonic.com/api/production/${uuid}.json -u $username:$password) fileName=$(echo "$status_response" | grep -o '"title": "[^"]*"' | cut -d'"' -f4)
# URL encode the filename encoded_name=$(printf "%s" "$fileName" | perl -MURI::Escape -ne 'print uri_escape($_)')
# Add counter to filename if it already exists base_filename="${fileName}" counter=1 while [ -f "$download_folder/${fileName}.${extension}" ]; do fileName="${base_filename}_${counter}" ((counter++)) done
# Download the file download_url="https://auphonic.com/api/download/audio-result/${uuid}/${encoded_name}.${extension}" curl -s -o "$download_folder/${fileName}.${extension}" $download_url -u $username:$password
# Increment index and check if there are more files to process next_index=$((current_index + 1)) should_continue="false" if [ $next_index -lt ${#uuids_array[@]} ]; then should_continue="true" fi
# Output variables for next iteration printf '{"alfredworkflow": {"arg": "", "variables": {"uuids": "%s", "current_index": "%s", "should_continue": "%s"}}}' "$uuids_string" "$next_index" "$should_continue"
# Show uploading status on Script Filter for a moment rm -f "$alfred_workflow_cache/status.txt"

#!/bin/bash
username="${username}" password="${password}"
# Get the array and current index uuids_string="${uuids}" current_index="${current_index}"
# Split the string into array using read read -r -a uuids_array <<< "${uuids_string}"
# Get current UUID being processed uuid="${uuids_array[$current_index]}"
# Get status for current UUID status_response=$(curl -s https://auphonic.com/api/production/$uuid.json -u $username:$password)
# Extract values using grep and cut code=$(echo "$status_response" | grep -o '"status": [0-9]*' | head -1 | cut -d' ' -f2) status=$(echo "$status_response" | grep -o '"status_string": "[^"]*"' | cut -d'"' -f4) url=$(echo "$status_response" | grep -o '"status_page": "[^"]*"' | cut -d'"' -f4) title=$(echo "$status_response" | grep -o '"title": "[^"]*"' | cut -d'"' -f4)
echo -n "$code" > "$alfred_workflow_cache/code.txt" echo -n "$status" > "$alfred_workflow_cache/status.txt" echo -n "$url" > "$alfred_workflow_cache/url.txt" echo -n "$title" > "$alfred_workflow_cache/title.txt" echo -n "$current_index" > "$alfred_workflow_cache/currentIndex.txt"
printf '{"alfredworkflow": {"arg": "", "variables": {"code": "%s", "status": "%s", "url": "%s", "title": "%s", "uuids": "%s", "current_index": "%s"}}}' "$code" "$status" "$url" "$title" "$uuids_string" "$current_index"

#!/bin/bash
# Initialize empty strings for UUIDs and filenames uuids=""
[ ! -d "$alfred_workflow_cache" ] && mkdir -p "$alfred_workflow_cache" echo -n "${#filePaths[@]}" > "$alfred_workflow_cache/totalItems.txt"
# Process each file passed as argument for file in "${filePaths}"; do theTitle=$(basename "${file%.*}") username="${username}" password="${password}" preset="${preset}"
response=$(curl -s -X POST https://auphonic.com/api/simple/productions.json \ -u $username:$password \ -F "preset=$preset" \ -F "title=$theTitle" \ -F "input_file=@$file" \ -F "action=start")
# Extract UUID using grep and cut instead of jq uuid=$(echo "$response" | grep -o '"uuid": "[^"]*"' | cut -d'"' -f4)
if [ ! -z "$uuid" ]; then uuids+=("$uuid") current_files+=("$theTitle") fi done
# Join arrays with space as delimiter uuids_string="${uuids[*]}" files_string="${current_files[*]}"
# Output the variables printf '{"alfredworkflow": {"arg": "", "variables": {"uuids": "%s", "current_index": "0", "allFiles": "%s"}}}' "$uuids_string" "$files_string"
# Show uploading status on Script Filter for a moment rm -f "$alfred_workflow_cache/status.txt"

#!/bin/bash
# Get the array and current index uuids_string="${uuids}" current_index="${current_index}"
# Split the string into array using read read -r -a uuids_array <<< "${uuids_string}"
# Increment index and check if there are more files to process next_index=$((current_index + 1)) should_continue="false" if [ $next_index -lt ${#uuids_array[@]} ]; then should_continue="true" fi
# Output variables for next iteration printf '{"alfredworkflow": {"arg": "", "variables": {"uuids": "%s", "current_index": "%s", "should_continue": "%s"}}}' "$uuids_string" "$next_index" "$should_continue"

# THESE VARIABLES MUST BE SET. SEE THE ONEUPDATER README FOR AN EXPLANATION OF EACH. readonly remote_info_plist='https://raw.githubusercontent.com/ognistik/alfred-auphonic/main/Workflow/info.plist' readonly workflow_url='https://raw.githubusercontent.com/ognistik/alfred-auphonic/main/Auphonic.alfredworkflow' readonly download_type='direct' readonly frequency_check='4'
# FROM HERE ON, CODE SHOULD BE LEFT UNTOUCHED! function abort { echo "${1}" >&2 exit 1 }
function url_exists { curl --silent --location --output /dev/null --fail --range 0-0 "${1}" }
function notification { local -r notificator="$(find . -type f -name 'notificator')"
if [[ -f "${notificator}" && "$(/usr/bin/file --brief --mime-type "${notificator}")" == 'text/x-shellscript' ]]; then "${notificator}" --message "${1}" --title "${alfred_workflow_name}" --subtitle 'A new version is available' return fi
osascript -e "display notification \"${1}\" with title \"${alfred_workflow_name}\" subtitle \"A new version is available\"" }
# Local sanity checks readonly local_info_plist='info.plist' readonly local_version="$(/usr/libexec/PlistBuddy -c 'print version' "${local_info_plist}")"
[[ -n "${local_version}" ]] || abort 'You need to set a workflow version in the configuration sheet.' [[ "${download_type}" =~ ^(direct|page|github_release)$ ]] || abort "'download_type' (${download_type}) needs to be one of 'direct', 'page', or 'github_release'." [[ "${frequency_check}" =~ ^[0-9]+$ ]] || abort "'frequency_check' (${frequency_check}) needs to be a number."
# Check for updates if [[ $(find "${local_info_plist}" -mtime +"${frequency_check}"d) ]]; then # Remote sanity check if ! url_exists "${remote_info_plist}"; then abort "'remote_info_plist' (${remote_info_plist}) appears to not be reachable." fi
readonly tmp_file="$(mktemp)" curl --silent --location --output "${tmp_file}" "${remote_info_plist}" readonly remote_version="$(/usr/libexec/PlistBuddy -c 'print version' "${tmp_file}")" rm "${tmp_file}"
if [[ "${local_version}" == "${remote_version}" ]]; then touch "${local_info_plist}" # Reset timer by touching local file exit 0 fi
if [[ "${download_type}" == 'page' ]]; then notification 'Opening download page…' open "${workflow_url}" exit 0 fi
readonly download_url="$( if [[ "${download_type}" == 'github_release' ]]; then osascript -l JavaScript -e 'function run(argv) { return JSON.parse(argv[0])["assets"].find(asset => asset["browser_download_url"].endsWith(".alfredworkflow"))["browser_download_url"] }' "$(curl --silent "https://api.github.com/repos/${workflow_url}/releases/latest")" else echo "${workflow_url}" fi )"
if url_exists "${download_url}"; then notification 'Downloading and installing…' readonly download_name="$(basename "${download_url}")" curl --silent --location --output "${HOME}/Downloads/${download_name}" "${download_url}" open "${HOME}/Downloads/${download_name}" else abort "'workflow_url' (${download_url}) appears to not be reachable." fi fi
There's been an error and it's not possible to upload.

# AUPHONIC FOR ALFRED ![](assets/auphonic-s.png)
[~ Visit on Github~ ](https://github.com/ognistik/alfred-auphonic) | [~ How I use Auphonic (Video) ~](https://youtu.be/n1EBrndi-jg) | [~Buy me a Coffe~](https://buymeacoffee.com/afadingthought)
Alfred workflow for seamlessly processing audio files through Auphonic's API. [Auphonic](https://auphonic.com?source=robper) is a professional audio post-production service that provides automated audio processing and optimization, including leveling, noise reduction, and encoding.
**This workflow streamlines the uploading/downloading of audio files for them to be processed using up to four of your Auphonic presets.**
--- ## FEATURES
- Process single or multiple audio files - Real-time notifications of processing status - Automatic download of processed files to Downloads folder - Error handling with automatic redirect to Auphonic production page
--- ## HOW TO
1. Select one or more files in Finder and open Alfred's actions window 2. Search for "Process with Auphonic" to process your files
The workflow keeps you updated in two ways: - System notifications showing processing status - Status updates in Alfred's search bar using your custom keyword
**Using Different Presets:** - No modifier: Uses default preset - Command (⌘): Uses preset 1 - Option (⌥): Uses preset 2 - Control (⌃): Uses preset 3
**Quick Tip:** If the Alfred search bar shows that no files are being processed, press CMD to open the last saved Auphonic URL. This helps when there's an error or server issue. You can always access your productions directly on Auphonic's website as well.
--- ## SUPPORTED FILE TYPES **Currently, the following file types are supported for upload:** - MP4 - MP3 - WAV - AIFF
**The following file types are supported for auto-download** - MP3 - WAV - M4A - MP4
Please make sure that your chosen preset includes the file type that you intend to download. If you need a different file type not listed here, let me know, and I'll be happy to add it—if possible.
--- *DISCLAIMER. Just a note letting you know that links in this README to Auphonic's site are affiliate ones, earning me a small commission if you ever decide to purchase processing credits through them, at no extra cost to you. I only recommend products I've personally vetted and believe are truly exceptional. Thanks for your support!*
Download and Update Index | Sets loop or not
Set variable to check status change
This keyword will only serve to check the status of upload/processing.
Make sure your chosen preset includes this file type.
